comment: Extremely sweet professor! Extra credit opportunities every Wednesday, as well as an extra credit opportunity for every test. You can exempt the final if you have a 95% average in the class, which was pretty easy considering all the extra credit that is offered. Tests were multiple choice, and she gives partial credit on questions missed.

Amazing professor! Would recommend her to anyone for MATH1160. Always opportunities for extra credit in this class as she has this thing called bonus Wednesdays. She gives quizzes every Wednesday which counts for bonus points towards your overall grade.

Prof. Ragsdale will review HW if requested and will stop to answer any questions about what you go over in class. She offers a weekly bonus quiz, and each test has a review guide for bonus points as well. You can easily go up 1 letter grade on EACH test with the bonus. You can also be exempt from the final exam with a 95+ average for the semester.

Prof. Ragsdale works through every single problem and explains the material so that it makes even the hardest of math problems understandable.I was very nervous coming into this class because I had never taken a calculus class before but she made the course material seem easier than it was. Don't skip class every single lecture matters. best prof!

Amazing Professor! Struggling with math but she teaches you how to do everything crystal clear. Take notes on everything and do not miss bonus Wednesdays. Very nice person and wants you to do well and makes herself very available if you are struggling. Makes corny jokes.
She was very caring and wanted everyone to succeed. All homework is in Pearson MML with weekly in-class bonus points available. She made calculus seem easy and was a great lecturer.

Professor Ragsdale is a GREAT professor! This is one of the hardest classes I have ever took, but professor Ragsdale made it bareable. I would say that this classs is lecture heavy, and if you do not go you WILL be confused. It is very important to study, and make sure that you understand the material fully. Her test are straightforward

This professor made a hard class somewhat easy. She gives you opportunities for extra bonus points for tests. She always makes sure you understand what's going on. I recommend showing up to each and every class bc if not, you will be highly confused. Also you need to do the hw bc it will affect your grade.

3 tests and a final (can exempt with a 95 in class). bonus point quizzes every wednesday and the test review online is bonus points. DO THE HOMEWORK! her lectures are fast pace and confusing sometimes so go to SI sessions.

Bonus quizzes every Wednesday. Tests are very similar to the study guides she gives out before. She does a review the class period before the test. Only other grades are math assignments for every section done through Pearson. If you do the assignments, go to class, and do the study guides it's an easy A.
Honestly,I went from previous reviews but she wasn't all of that. Her lectures are boring. Tests are so hard. She is rude if you miss her classes. If you don't like going to campus, don't take her.

Took her after reading kind reviews
I've been to a few lectures so far but unimpressed.
Her teaching style is so so but she hates if you have to leave early. *I'm full time with 6 classes not as an excuse but I do try my best*. If you miss class often she will not greet you (bitter attitude- unfriendly in general). 
HW is easy, tests are hard

she made a difficult class very easy by readily answering questions in class to ensure everyone knew the topics. never got annoyed if she had to stop one topic to explain another. had bonus quizzes every wednesday that helps your test grade. Lots of homework but includes explanations to work it out and has a bonus review

Bonus Wednesday is a thing so go those days. 3 tests and Mylab home work is all grades, if you have a 95 average in class which is easily doable with those bonus points you do not have to take the final. One of the most genuine teachers i've taken, extremely kind and will help you get an A. She gives practice tests to prepare for tests aswell.

Do yourself a favor and take her! I was extremely nervous coming into a calculus class and she made everything extremely easy to understand. Every Wednesday is bonus Wednesday where you take 1-4 question mini quizzes that give you bonus test points and they can only help you! I got 10 extra points on a test once! Great teacher and kind woman!

Professor Ragsdale gives every student many opportunities to earn extra credit. There is an extra credit quiz every Wednesday that can only help you, not hurt you. She gives partial credit on every test and tells you what not to study for the final exam. Very accessible and tries to help as much as she possibly can. She has good math jokes too! :)

Great professor! I have failed all my math classes since I came into college. Ms. Ragsdale is a fantastic professor. Coming from someone who struggles in math, she breaks it down very easily. As long as you do your homework, study, and come to class every day, you'll pass. SHOW UP FOR BONUS QUIZZES!

Professor Ragsdale is great. She gives plenty of extra credit opportunities which can be a huge difference maker in your grade. There are also tutoring sessions she holds and she ahs office hours. Although, if you miss class you are going to be behind by a lot. Do not miss class... Like seriously.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Terri was really a great professor. I took her for MATH1160 and learned a lot. She cares about her students and is always available for questions. Her office hours were really useful before tests, as she would answer any questions. Review day is the day before the test, and she gives lots of extra credit opportunities.

Professor Ragsdale is so sweet and great at what she does! Her lectures are straightforward and she gives many examples and ways of explaining something. Quizzes were for extra credit and the tests were similar to the study guides. This is by far the best math class I've taken. She also tells math puns during lecture.

Professor Ragsdale is honestly the best math teacher I've ever had. This was my second time taking Elementary Calc and she taught in a way that I could actually understand the material and offered so much extra credit. Take her you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I think that Professor Ragsdale is one of the sweetest people ever. She really cares about her students and does her best to make a hard subject easy to understand. She is very easy to ask questions to and helps you understand if you need help. She also does bonus wednsdays, which gives you bonus points on your tests!

prof ragsdale is a great prof. she has like a 1 or 2 question bonus quiz every week which goes on your test and its great. She covers a lot of material in class but it isnt hard so at least get someone to send you notes if you skip. if ur final is higher than ur lowest test she drops the lowest and counts your final twice. homework is easy as well
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is one of my favorites professors at KSU. I've never taken trigonometry before not even in high school but she really knows her stuff and has funny math jokes to engage students. Only problem with her is that she goes a little too fast sometimes and I couldn't keep up. She is nice and has BONUS WEDNESDAY which helped me alot.

Professor Ragsdale is amazing for Trig. Bonus Wednesdays every Wednesday, plenty of opportunities to come in and ask questions or participate in study and review sessions outside of class, all homework is relatively easy and on my math lab, and the tests arent a huge worry because of all the bonus points. But go to class lectures are important!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Ragsdale is amazing and she truly cares about what she does and her students. If you truly study and attend her office hours, this class is an easy A. She wants you to succeed; she has this thing called bonus Wednesdays where she gives you a few problems you need to work out and if you get it right, its bonus points on the test!
super sweet teacher and really cares about her students. easy tests
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is very clear in her class about how points are counted. She does let you replace your lowest test grade with the final and she does extra credit quizzes every week. With my math lab she only requires you to get a 75% to get dull credit since sometimes it can be very silly about how you put the answers in. Also tells very lame math jokes.

Professor Ragsdale was amazing. The class was not easy, but I think it is because the content isn't what people are used to having in a lower level math class. There is a lot of homework, but it is actually really really helpful in understanding the content. She gives extra credit opportunities every week that add points to each test,

She is an amazing professor!!! I am not good at math but she made the material easy to understand and offered a lot of extra credit in the form of bonus quizzes. She truly cares about students' success and answered all questions very thoroughly. Her tests were EXTREMELY fair and followed the same format that she used in her notes.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I enjoyed taking her class. She is a very helpful teacher and continuously goes over practice problems until everyone has a good understanding. Her tests are straight forward and you will pass as long as you do the study guide and homework.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Solid choice. I suck at math so I almost dropped her after the first day because of how fast she went, but you get used to it and she explains the material really well. Gives bonus points that are added onto tests, and your grades are 4 tests and the homeworks add up to a test. She gives tons of opportunities for you to do well. Take her!!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: I loved Ragsdale, she gave EC every Wednesday. She teaches fast because she's been over the concepts so much, but if you actually ask her questions she will stop and go over the material til you understand. I had an SI tutor during her class which really helped me. If you have a 96 (I think) you can exempt the final. Lots of homework, but it helps.

Her homeworkk takes 6 hours a week to do. No partial credit, it's either right or wrong. tests are nothing like study guides. very tough calculus class. she is much easier in the lower level math classes. Calc 1 is a hard class with her. take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: TAKE! She's great, extra credit every Wednesday, homework twice week not mandatory but if you do it you get extra credit. Grades based on point system, so earn it while it's easy! I exempted my final with good grades on all four tests, plus that homework. Attendance helps for that credit, but I also taught myself most of it from the book, not hard
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Prof. Ragsdale really knows what she's talking about. I took her for trigonometry and she made it easy to understand. She is really patient when any of her students don't quite understand something and she is more than willing to help. Also, there are tons of opportunities for extra credit if you really want a good grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Fantastic and funny professor who genuinely wants her students to learn. Normally professors move on if you don't get something, but she takes the time to teach and to be understood. Offers bonuses on things covered in class and the test reviews are bonuses. My Math Lab questions are very similar to tests.

Easy lecture, just goes through laws and examples. Homework matches lectures, tests match lectures. Gives bonus wednesday's - like a pop quiz but its extra credit. do the test review, that's extra credit. Final exam will replace lowest test.

She is a great teacher who is in tune to the needs of the students and understands how students best learn complex math rules. Her teaching methods are also excellent; she relies on a piece of paper and projector during her lessons, making it simple to take notes during class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Ragsdale is an amazing professor! The way that she teaches calculus is easy to understand! As long as you study your notes and homework, the bonus day and tests are easy! She is worth taking!

Goes fast but she will stop to ensure you understand. Extra credit every week. Study guides that are similar to the test. She's available in her office for an hour before every test. Super patient. Really kind and funny. Lots of homework but it's not too hard if you make time for it. If there are seats available, take her class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Ragsdals was an amazing math teacher. She makes sure everyone in the class understands what is being taught. Math lab assignments are extremely easy. She always goes over all of the material that will be on tests & gives chances for bonus points for tests. I loved her!

If you go to class and take notes it is an easy A. She doesn't move on until everybody understands. Make sure to do the homework because it is a pretty big amount of your grade. Her study guides are identical to the test. She just changes the numbers. She offers extra credit every single week that adds onto your test grade. Such a great teacher.

she dosnt care if you come to class or not, but it shows her how much you care about her class. does bonus thursday. funny af . take her. after every class there is homework on what you did that day. not hard at all but might take some time to do (not too long). has a study guided for each test and goes through it and tests are fairly easy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: BEST TEACHER IN THE WORLD!! She is such an awesome teacher and she will gladly help you out if you need the help. She also tells math jokes that are cheesy but some are funny. If I could take her again I would! You should definitely take her class.
Greatest math teacher I have taken. She teaches well and even offers extra credit every week. Practice test are identical to real test. Take her!!!

Fairly easy A. Takes attendance so you have to regularly attend class, but she's super helpful and not boring. Gives practice tests that are exactly what you should expect on the actual test, so study those until you know them left and right and you'll make an A! Also offers "Bonus Thursdays" for extra credit points.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's great at teaching math. Really cares about the students and that they know the material.
